name: Surgical Care Crisis
title: Highest Risk of Impoverishing Expenditure for Surgical Care
description: In 2022, 100% of the population in Burundi was at risk of impoverishing expenditure for surgical care, the highest in the world.

name: Stunted Growth Challenge
title: High Prevalence of Stunting in Children Under 5
description: As of 2024, 52.8% of children under 5 in Burundi are affected by stunting, with 49.1% of females and 56.6% of males experiencing this condition.

name: Agricultural Backbone
title: High Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2023, 85.05% of Burundi's workforce was employed in agriculture, with 92.02% of females and 77.60% of males working in this sector.

name: Cooking Challenges
title: Limited Access to Clean Cooking Technologies
description: In 2022, only 0.2% of Burundi's urban population and 0.1% of the total population had access to clean fuels and technologies for cooking, highlighting a significant challenge in energy access.

name: Banking Beginnings
title: Low Bank Depositor Rate
description: As of 2020, Burundi had only 12.16 depositors per 1,000 adults, indicating a nascent banking culture and limited financial inclusion.

name: Energy Investment
title: Modest Energy Investments
description: In 2023, Burundi attracted $1,000,000 in private energy investments, a step towards enhancing its energy infrastructure.

name: Digital Divide
title: Low Internet Usage Among Females
description: In 2017, only 1.49% of females and 3.91% of males in Burundi used the internet, reflecting a significant digital divide and limited internet penetration.

name: Economic Struggles
title: Low GDP and GNI per Capita
description: In 2023, Burundi's GDP per capita was $193.01, while GNI per capita was $220, indicating economic challenges and low income levels.

name: Agricultural Reliance
title: Low Value Added in Agriculture
description: In 2023, the value added per worker in agriculture was $216.18, highlighting the need for increased productivity in the sector.

name: Service Sector Growth
title: Limited Employment in Services
description: In 2023, only 11.88% of Burundi's total employment was in the service sector, with 7.43% of female employment and 16.64% of male employment in services.

name: Educational Challenges
title: Low Male Primary Education Completion
description: In 2017, only 22.69% of males aged 25 and above had completed primary education, indicating educational challenges.

name: Healthcare Workforce
title: Scarce Specialist Surgical Workforce
description: In 2018, Burundi had only 0.4 specialist surgeons per 100,000 population, highlighting a significant gap in healthcare services.
